breaking_news.title: China‑linked DKnife toolkit hijacks router traffic for espionage
breaking_news.summary:
Researchers uncovered a Linux‑based framework called DKnife that has been used since 2019 to perform adversary‑in‑the‑middle attacks on edge routers. The toolkit performs deep‑packet inspection, traffic manipulation and malware delivery and is attributed to China‑aligned threat actors.

The abuse compromises telecommunications providers, ISP back‑bones and government networks, allowing attackers to intercept, alter and inject malicious payloads at the network edge. Because the compromise occurs on widely deployed routing hardware, the attack surface spans critical infrastructure and enterprise environments, raising urgent mitigation concerns.

breaking_news.title: CISA warns of unauthenticated SmarterMail RCE exploited by ransomware gangs
breaking_news.summary:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency issued an alert for CVE‑2026‑24423, an unauthenticated remote‑code‑execution flaw in the SmarterMail email platform that is actively leveraged in ransomware campaigns. Attackers can send crafted HTTP requests to execute arbitrary code on the mail server without credentials.

Enterprises, schools, hospitals and other organizations that rely on SmarterMail face full server compromise, data exfiltration and ransomware encryption. The vulnerability’s public exploitation status makes rapid patching essential to prevent widespread disruption.

breaking_news.title: Compromised dYdX npm and PyPI packages deliver wallet stealers and RATs
breaking_news.summary:
Security researchers discovered that legitimate packages for the dYdX DeFi protocol on npm and the Python Package Index had been replaced with malicious versions that install cryptocurrency‑stealing malware and remote‑access trojans. The supply‑chain attack targets developers who automatically pull dependencies, silently compromising their build environments.

The compromise endangers cryptocurrency users, DeFi platforms and any software projects that depend on the tainted packages, potentially resulting in private‑key theft and full system takeover. The incident highlights the growing risk of malicious code injection into widely used open‑source repositories.

breaking_news.title: VMware ESXi sandbox‑escape flaw CVE‑2025‑22225 actively exploited in ransomware attacks
breaking_news.summary:
CISA confirmed that ransomware operators are exploiting CVE‑2025‑22225, an arbitrary‑write vulnerability in VMware ESXi that enables a VM‑escape to the hypervisor kernel. The flaw allows attackers with VM access to execute code on the host and gain control over the entire virtualization environment.

Enterprises, cloud service providers and data‑center operators that run ESXi are at risk of full host compromise and ransomware encryption of critical workloads. The active exploitation status and the difficulty of detection make this a top‑priority patching emergency.

breaking_news.title: Critical SolarWinds Web Help Desk RCE (CVE‑2025‑40551) exploited against U.S. agencies
breaking_news.summary:
A critical unauthenticated remote‑code‑execution vulnerability (CVE‑2025‑40551) in SolarWinds Web Help Desk was disclosed and is being actively used in attacks targeting U.S. federal networks. The flaw stems from unsafe deserialization of attacker‑controlled data, allowing full system compromise.

All organizations that deploy SolarWinds WHD for ticketing are exposed to potential takeover, credential theft and lateral movement within their networks. The U.S. government has set a hard deadline for patching, underscoring the severity of the threat across both public and private sectors.

breaking_news.title: React2Shell (CVE‑2025‑55182) NGINX hijacking campaign redirects massive web traffic
breaking_news.summary:
Threat actors are exploiting the React2Shell vulnerability (CVE‑2025‑55182) to compromise NGINX servers and popular Baota control panels, inserting malicious configurations that reroute user traffic through attacker‑controlled infrastructure. The campaign has been observed targeting thousands of web hosts worldwide.

Web‑hosting providers, SaaS platforms and any organization running vulnerable NGINX instances risk large‑scale traffic hijacking, credential harvesting and malware distribution. The widespread nature of the abuse makes rapid detection and remediation essential for protecting internet‑facing services.

breaking_news.title: Asian state‑backed APT group TGR‑STA‑1030 breaches 70 government and infrastructure networks
breaking_news.summary:
Palo Alto Networks Unit 42 uncovered a previously unknown espionage group, TGR‑STA‑1030, linked to an Asian nation‑state, that has infiltrated at least 70 government agencies and critical‑infrastructure operators across 37 countries. The campaign employs custom malware, supply‑chain compromises and extensive reconnaissance of high‑value targets.

Compromised ministries, energy utilities, transport systems and other essential services face potential data exfiltration and long‑term espionage. The breadth of the intrusion highlights a sophisticated, state‑sponsored threat that could influence geopolitical stability and critical‑infrastructure resilience.

breaking_news.title: Critical remote‑code execution flaw (CVE‑2026‑25049) in n8n workflow platform disclosed with public exploit
breaking_news.summary:
A new critical vulnerability (CVE‑2026‑25049) in the open‑source n8n workflow automation tool allows unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary system commands via crafted workflow definitions, bypassing prior mitigations. Public exploit code was released simultaneously, accelerating potential abuse.

Enterprises that rely on n8n for process automation face immediate risk of server takeover, credential theft and lateral movement within their environments. Organizations must apply the vendor patch and audit existing workflows to prevent exploitation.
